AT3G46740.text_summary: MAR1 POSSESSES MUTATION IN TOC75-III GENE (19211693). MAR1 OVEREXPRESSION CAUSES HYPERSENSITIVITY TO ANTIBIOTICS (19675150), IRON STARVATION PHENOTYPES (20592808). MAR1 LOCALIZES TO CHLOROPLAST (32297017, 19675150). MAR1 ENHANCES RESISTANCE TO ANTIBIOTICS (19675150). MAR1 ENCODES A PROTEIN WITH 11 PUTATIVE TRANSMEMBRANE DOMAINS (19675150). MAR1 ACCUMULATES GENTAMICIN (19675150). MAR1 CAUSES CHLOROSIS (19675150). MAR1 PLAYS A ROLE IN CELLULAR IRON HOMEOSTASIS (19675150). MAR1 MAINTAINS ANTIBIOTIC ENTRY (20592808). MAR1 DELIVERS IRON CHELATION MOLECULE (20592808). MAR1 LOSS-OF-FUNCTION MUTATIONS CONFER ANTIBIOTIC RESISTANCE (20592808). TOC75 INTERACTS WITH TOC159 (28745032), TOC34 (28745032), TIC110 (28745032). TOC75 FUNCTIONS AS PREPROTEIN TRANSLOCATION CHANNEL (18621981), MAIN PROTEIN IMPORT TRANSLOCATION CHANNEL (19704458). TOC75 LOCALIZES TO 880-KD TOC COMPLEX (28745032), 1-MD COMPLEX (28745032). TOC75 MAINTAINS ATTOC159 (12951325). TOC75 AFFECTS PROTEIN TRANSLOCATION (15908591). TOC75 PRODUCES TOC COMPLEX (16415065). TOC75 REPRESSES PROTEIN IMPORT (19403728). TOC75 INDISPENSABLE FROM VERY EARLY STAGE OF EMBRYOGENESIS (19704458). TOC75 ACCUMULATES IN PLASTID ENVELOPE (20097790). TOC75 BINDS TIC236 (30464337). TOC75-III ENCODES FOR PORE-FORMING TOC COMPONENT (23131143). ATTOC159 INTERACTS WITH TOC75 (12951325). TOC34 MAINTAINS TOC75 (12951325). TOC-TIC SUPERCOMPLEX CONTAINS TOC75 (28745032). TIC236 CO-EVOLVED WITH TOC75 (30464337). BAMA SIMILAR TO TOC75 (30464337). PLSP1 METABOLIZES TOC75 & OE33 (20097790). LOW IRON REPRESSES MAR1 (19675150).
